question: Match the following:
column_II: Epidermis, endothecium, middle layers and tapetum

matches.right: Epidermis, endothecium, middle layers and tapetum

answer: Androecium → Consists of stamens, Gynoecium → Represents the female reproductive organs, Bilobed, dithecous and tetrasporangiate → A typical anther, Microsporangium wall layers → Epidermis, endothecium, middle layers and tapetum, Sporogenous tissue undergoes meiosis → Forms tetrads of microspores

question: Match the following:
column_I: Cells at the time of shedding
column_II: Made up of sporopollenin and has germ pores

matches.right: Made up of sporopollenin and has germ pores

matches.left: Cells at the time of shedding

answer: Pollen grains → Male gametophytic generation, Pollen wall layers → Two-layered wall, Exine → Made up of sporopollenin and has germ pores, Intine → Inner wall layer, Cells at the time of shedding → Two cells or three cells

question: Match the following:
column_II: Stalk called funicle, protective integuments, micropyle
Divides meiotically to form one megaspore
Two synergids and an egg cell at micropylar end

matches.right: Stalk called funicle, protective integuments, micropyle
Divides meiotically to form one megaspore
Two synergids and an egg cell at micropylar end

answer: Pistil → Stigma, style and ovary, Ovules → Stalk called funicle, protective integuments, micropyle, Megaspore mother cell → Divides meiotically to form one megaspore, Mature embryo sac → 7-celled and 8-nucleate, Egg apparatus → Two synergids and an egg cell at micropylar end

question: Match the following:
column_II: Two fusion events in each embryo sac
Diploid cell formed after male gamete fuses with egg
Fusion of two male gametes with polar nuclei

matches.right: Two fusion events in each embryo sac
Diploid cell formed after male gamete fuses with egg
Fusion of two male gametes with polar nuclei

answer: Double fertilisation → Two fusion events in each embryo sac, Syngamy → Diploid cell formed after male gamete fuses with egg, Triple fusion → Fusion of two male gametes with polar nuclei, Zygote → Develops into the embryo, Primary endosperm cell → Forms endosperm tissue

question: Match the following:
answer: Dicotyledonous embryo → Two cotyledons and embryonal axis, Monocotyledonous embryo → Single cotyledon, Ovary after fertilisation → Develops into fruit, Ovules after fertilisation → Develop into seeds, Apomixis → Formation of seeds without fertilisation
